title: Policy Iteration

definitions.Policy Iteration: A method used in reinforcement learning where the policy is iteratively improved. The agent evaluates the current policy and then updates it to maximize the expected return.

formulas: V(s) = \sum_{a \in A} \pi(a|s) \cdot R(s, a) + \gamma \sum_{s' \in S} P(s'|s, a) \cdot V(s')
summary: The slide presents the concept of Policy Iteration in reinforcement learning, where an agent iteratively improves its policy to maximize the expected return. It includes a formula for calculating the value function V(s) based on the current policy \pi(a|s), the reward function R(s, a), and the discount factor \gamma.
